title: How important is your smartphone to your daily life? - Quora

response.answer_text: You want to set an alarm for early morning. You don’t have an alarm-clock. You have alarm in your smartphone.You want to scribble down an important note. You don’t have a pen and a piece of paper. You have notes in your smartphone.You want to listen to the music. You don’t have a radio. You have Music player in your smartphone.You want to go to a place you’ve never been before. You don’t know the route. You’ve GPS in your smartphone.You want to pay electric bill for the last month. You don’t have a vehicle to drive down and pay. You’ve Paytm in your smartphone.Some bank is asking for a scanned copy of your document. You don’t have a scanner. You’ve camscanner in your smartphone.Your friend want to buy a smartphone. You want to send your friend some money. You don’t have cash. You’ve Tez/CashApp in your smartphone.A relative of yours is arguing over some fact that you know he is wrong about. You don’t have anybody taking your side. You’ve google search in your smartphone.And the list goes on and on. Still your mom thinks you’re wasting your time with your smartphone.

Fairly important: I take a walk around lunchtime and use my wireless headphone to listen to my saved music. I use it a few times in the evening to look up some info. It and my iWatch remind me of meetings I need to go to and new emails. I check the weather every morning. I use the exercise reminders and monitors in my iWatch and phone. I get texts every few days from my children (I have 5). It’s not essential, but a nice lifestyle upgrade :) I rarely use it as a cellphone.
